title: Due from National Banks, Central Reserve Cities for United States
notes:
Data Were Derived By Adding The Sum Of Three Classifications: Due From National Banks; Due From State Banks; Due From Reserve Agents (Where Itemized Separately). Monthly Coverage Varies From Year To Year. Except For 1882, Which Only Has Figures For October And December, All Years Have Scattered Five Month Coverage. Central Reserve Cities Are New York, St. Louis, Chicago. Source: Computed By NBER From Figures In Annual Reports Of The Comptroller Of The Currency.

This NBER data series m14035 appears on the NBER website in Chapter 14 at http://www.nber.org/databases/macrohistory/contents/chapter14.html.

NBER Indicator: m14035
